tool.name: HybPiper Assemble

param.name: target_format
param.label: Target Sequence Format
param.help: Sequence format of the target file

param.name: search_method
param.label: Which mapping method to use?
param.help: Changes which method Hybpiper uses for the mapping of the reads to the target sequences.

param.name: run_intronerate_bool
param.label: Run Intronerate?
param.help: Run intronerate to recover fasta files for supercontigs with introns. Intronerate is enabled by default since Hybpiper v2.1.6

param.name: create_heatmap_bool
param.label: Generate Heatmap?
param.help: Generate a heatmap of the gene recovery

param.name: time_out
param.label: Enter timeout % as a whole number, enter '0' for default
param.help: Kill long-running gene assemblies if they take longer than X percent of average

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
Run the Hybpiper pipeline
.. class:: infomark
For a guide on how to use this tool and it's supplementary tools (extract_loci and phylo analysis) please visit the README file on the GitHub repository: https://github.com/naturalis/galaxy-pipeline-hybseq
.. class:: infomark
Everything of note that the pipeline generates will be sorted into files and then packaged into a single ZIP file.
.. class:: warningmark
Hybpiper, by default, expects unpaired reads, two for each sample. Every sample must share the same name and a _R1/_R2 prefix to indicate they are a pair.
.. class:: infomark
Example: NG440_R1_test.fastq and NG440_R2_test.fastq
